title: Liverpool parade collision: 47 people injured, including two seriously – latest updates
snippets:
Ambulance service says 27 people were taken to hospital, with 20 treated at the scene; two are seriously injured including one child

  • News report: Dozens injured as car ploughs into crowd at Liverpool FC victory paraded

Steve Rotheram, mayor of the Liverpool city region, has thanked first responders for their “swift action” on a “difficult day”.

He said: “Our hearts go out to all of those affected, especially those who have been injured. Thank you, as ever, to the first responders for their professionalism and swift action.

Liverpool city region's mayor, Steve Rotheram, expressed gratitude towards first responders for their quick response and extended sympathies to those affected.

title: Australia news live: Ed Husic says government ‘probably’ considering sanctions against Israel; Norwegian princess bound for Sydney uni
snippets:
Former Labor minister has called for the government to move beyond words to action. Follow today’s news live

  • Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

Former Labor minister Ed Husic has called for the government to move beyond words to action, and said sanctions on Israel are “probably under consideration”.

After Anthony Albanese on Monday said Israel’s blockade of aid into Gaza was “an outrage”, Husic said the prime minister’s comments were important but the government should do “whatever we can”. He told ABC Radio National:

We’ve got to the threshold where there’s an expectation we move beyond words … We should be speaking up, but beyond speaking up, I think it’s important that we act, and I certainly think it’s vital our government joins with others to be able to do that.

The third area I think we should be actively considering, and I suspect it’s probably under consideration, is drawing up a list of targeted sanctions where we can join with others … we should be ready to move when others move as well, to be able to exert maximum international pressure to stop this blockade and to help people in Gaza.

Getting dairy backs and productive is important. Getting them back to pre-flood is not about days and weeks. This is months and longer to really see these enterprises back where they want to be.

Floods come along and they’re devastating but they capture attention and we respond to that. Drought is different but the pain those people are experiencing is just as great as on the mid-north Coast and other places. …

The key thing is they need the short-term help but they really need to be able to hear from our industry and government and leaders that support will be ongoing. It shouldn’t just run out when the headlines fade, but be there for the long time.

Continue reading...

He also highlighted the need for ongoing support for communities affected by floods and droughts, stressing that recovery and assistance should exte

title: Gausman pitches 8 innings and Varsho homers as Blue Jays beat Rangers
snippets: Kevin Gausman struck out six over eight strong innings, Daulton Varsho had a solo homer among his three hits and the Toronto Blue Jays beat the Texas Rangers on Monday.  Gausman (5-4) threw 72 of his 96 pitches for strikes, including his first 14, and didn’t walk a batter.  Jeff Hoffman worked a perfect ninth for his 11th save in 14 chances.

Kevin Gausman struck out six over eight strong innings, Daulton Varsho had a solo homer among his three hits and the Toronto Blue Jays beat the Texas Rangers 2-1 on Monday.  Gausman (5-4) threw 72 of his 96 pitches for strikes, including his first 14, and didn't walk a batter.  Jeff Hoffman worked a perfect ninth for his 11th save in 14 chances.
titles: Gausman pitches 8 innings and Varsho homers as Blue Jays beat Rangers
Gausman pitches 8 innings and Varsho homers as Blue Jays beat Rangers 2-1
summary: Kevin Gausman led the Toronto Blue Jays to a 2-1 victory over the Texas Rangers with a standout eight-inning performance, striking out six and not issuing a walk. He threw 72 of his 96 pitches for strikes. Daulton Varsho contributed significantly with a solo home run among his three hits. Jeff Hoffman secured the win by pitching a perfect ninth inning, achieving his 11th save in 14 opportunities.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides a basic understanding of a sports event, but does not offer deeper insights or implications beyond the game itself. It does not contribute to the reader's decision-making or sense of agency, nor does it report on broader trends or impacts in the sports world.

title: Ohtani leads off with homer for 2nd straight game for 2nd time in his major league career
snippets: Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani has hit a leadoff homer in consecutive games for the second time in his career.  The reigning National League MVP drove a low, inside fastball from Cleveland's Gavin Williams into the right-field stands for his major league-leading 19th homer of the season Monday night.  It was Ohtani's fifth leadoff homer this season and 17th since arriving in the majors from Japan in 2018.
titles: Ohtani leads off with homer for 2nd straight game for 2nd time in his major league career
summary: Los Angeles Dodgers' Shohei Ohtani hit a leadoff home run in consecutive games for the second time in his career, marking his major league-leading 19th homer of the season. The hit came off Cleveland's Gavin Williams, contributing to Ohtani's fifth leadoff homer this year and his 17th since joining MLB from Japan in 2018.
constructiveness_reason: While the story provides some awareness about Shohei Ohtani's achievement, it lacks depth and insight. There's no actionable information or broader context about the significance of this event in the baseball world.

A major study from Brazil has found that people in their 50s with hearing loss face a greater risk of cognitive decline. The findings, published in the [...]
titles: Middle-Age Hearing Loss Could Accelerate Cognitive Decline
summary: A study of 805 Brazilians in their 50s, observed over eight years, has found that hearing loss may significantly increase the risk of cognitive decline, suggesting that improved attention to hearing health could be key in preventing dementia.

title: Landmark Study Shows Ozempic May Treat This Deadly Liver Disease
snippets: An international study reveals that the drug can reverse liver damage in patients. An international study led by researchers from Virginia Commonwealth University (VCU) and King’s College London suggests that semaglutide, the active substance found in medications like Ozempic and Wegovy, can halt and potentially reverse a common liver disease affecting millions globally. The research [...]
titles: Landmark Study Shows Ozempic May Treat This Deadly Liver Disease
summary: A landmark international study involving Virginia Commonwealth University (VCU) and King’s College London has discovered that semaglutide, the active ingredient in medications such as Ozempic and Wegovy, can halt and potentially reverse liver damage caused by a widespread liver disease. This finding opens new therapeutic avenues for millions of patients globally affected by this condition.
constructiveness_reason: This story is highly constructive. It reports on a solution to a widespread health problem, providing actionable insights for patients and healthcare providers. It also increases awareness about the potential use of existing medications for new treatments.

title: 30% Weight Loss in a Week? The Metabolic “Kill Switch” Scientists Just Discovered
snippets: Scientists genetically altered mice so they couldn’t make the amino acid cysteine and fed them a diet completely lacking it. In just one week, the mice lost a staggering 30% of their body weight. This dramatic weight loss was due to a breakdown in energy metabolism caused by the depletion of coenzyme A, a molecule [...]
titles: 30% Weight Loss in a Week? The Metabolic “Kill Switch” Scientists Just Discovered
summary: Scientists have discovered a metabolic process that led to a significant weight loss in mice by genetically modifying them to be unable to produce the amino acid cysteine and feeding them a diet devoid of it. This resulted in a 30% weight loss within a week due to a breakdown in energy metabolism, linked to the depletion of coenzyme A, a crucial molecule in the body's energy pathways.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about a scientific discovery related to weight loss. However, it is not clear if this discovery can be applied to humans or if it has any practical implications for weight loss strategies. Therefore, while it offers some degree of insight, its usefulness and progress are limited.

title: Cord blood banking is not living up to its promise
snippets: Banking a baby’s umbilical cord blood was once seen as a reasonable way to protect their future health, but much of that potential has turned out to be mere hype
titles: Cord blood banking is not living up to its promise
summary: Banking a baby's umbilical cord blood, initially thought to safeguard their future health, has largely been debunked as overhyped. The anticipated health benefits and potential applications have not materialized as expected, leading to a reassessment of its value and practicality.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive because it provides useful information for parents-to-be who might be considering cord blood banking. It increases awareness about the current state of the science and technology, and informs the reader about the reassessment of its value and practicality. However, it doesn't report on solutions or improvements to the issue.

title: Scientists establish new genus after discovering new marine flagellate
snippets: Researchers at the University of Tsukuba have identified a previously unknown species of unicellular organism in seawater collected near Hachijojima Island. The newly discovered species, named Viscidocauda repens, belongs to the protist group Endomyxa and is notable for possessing a persistent flagellum—marking the first recorded instance of such a flagellate within this group.
titles: Scientists establish new genus after discovering new marine flagellate
summary: Researchers at the University of Tsukuba discovered a new unicellular organism species, Viscidocauda repens, in seawater near Hachijojima Island. This species, part of the Endomyxa protist group, is unique for having a persistent flagellum, a first for this group.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful knowledge about a new discovery in the field of marine biology. It increases awareness about new species and their unique characteristics. However, it doesn't clearly highlight any progress, solutions or empowering knowledge beyond the discovery itself.
